channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Norma Desmond, JFK, a Martian Pastel, and What’s American Studies?
item.description: A salute to David Lubin, an American art buccaneer now retiring from Wake Forest University.

item.title: Trump Is Down, but Not Out, in the Tariffs Court Case
item.description: It’s a case he should lose, but it’s no slam dunk.

item.title: Trump considering federal takeover of New York 9/11 memorial
item.description: The Trump administration is looking into whether it can take control of the 9/11 memorial and museum in New York City.

item.title: Textbook Bias Is a Real Problem
item.description: At the corporate level, textbook companies rival liberal arts campuses in their progressive orthodoxies.

item.title: GOP lawmakers share pictures and praise of their night at Rose Garden Club
item.description: President Trump dined in his newly renovated Rose Garden at the White House with his allies in Congress in what they're calling the Rose Garden Club.

item.title: U.S. says it will deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Eswatini because he fears deportation to Uganda
item.description: Attorneys for Immigration and Customs Enforcement said in a Friday letter that they intend to send Kilmar Abrego Garcia to the African nation of Eswat...

item.title: Is Wuthering Heights The Smutty BookTok Feminists’ Final Conquest?
item.description: Emerald Fennell remakes 'Wuthering Heights' in the image of bookstore bargain bins and terminal late-stage feminism.

item.title: The Silent Tax Killing American Productivity
item.description: Every unnecessary delay, form, and regulation is a hidden tax on our most precious resource.

item.title: Trump says 'Department of WAR' could reach Chicago
item.description: President Trump threatened a "Chipocalypse Now" in Chicago, led by the War Department, in a post with the likeness of the movie "Apocalypse Now."

item.title: What to know about a large-scale immigration raid at a Georgia manufacturing plant
item.description: Hundreds of federal agents descended on a sprawling site where Hyundai manufactures electric vehicles in Georgia and detained 475 people, most of them...

item.title: Dearborn Heights’ Arabic Police Patch Snafu Is A Badge Of Surrender
item.description: Dearborn Heights, Michigan, Mayor Bill Bazzi announced Friday that the new Arabic police patch was not “official” — but didn’t rule out adopting such ...

item.title: Minneapolis Dems: We Know Our Election Was Rigged But Let’s Keep The Results Anyway
item.description: The voting process at the Minneapolis Democratic-Farmer-Labor (DFL) Party convention in July was such a mess that state DFL leadership investigated an...

item.title: NY Times Dubs Deadly Drugs A ‘Consumer Product’ Because The Media Don’t Take The Problem Seriously
item.description: It’s perfectly fine that people are raising questions about the legality of President Trump unilaterally ordering military strikes on suspected drug s...

item.title: How Phonics Instruction Helped Indiana Kids Read Better Than Many Adults
item.description: Sixth in the nation, Indiana invested heavily in literacy and requires training in science of reading methods to teach children to read.

item.title: Lawfare and Constant Emergencies Put the Judiciary at Risk
item.description: A year of peril lies ahead for the federal courts.
